review: I've only had this for five months and it already freezes up and any program keeps pausing.
author: Carla

review: This item is essentially useless if you use Charter for a cable provider. None of the apps you can use to stream (HBO go, Showtime, etc) work with Charter. I know this is Charter's fault, not Amazon's but save yourself the money and get a Roku or Apple TV so you can actually use the apps they advertise. How doesn't hate Charter?!
author: Josh

review: Love it, haven't watched anything but the shows on firestick.

review: There are better options on the market. The stick worked fine for about a month but then stopped holding connections. Even if I can get it to pull up the home screen it's slow and can't connect the apps. Wish I had my $40 and Amazon had this stick.
author: cynthia marsiglia

review: Beware! Don't purchase if you have an AARIS router!!! I loved the device when it was working however, after many issues, trouble shooting and phone calls I was finally told that the fire TV stick isn't compatible with my router. Amazon said there is nothing they can do about this and did allow me a no hassle return. I am extremely disappointed but it looks like I am being forced to switch to a Roku!
author: Treasa H.

review: I was really excited to get this, currently we use our PS3 for streaming Netflix, Amazon prime, etc in the living room, and my computer (hooked up to the TV via HDMI) in the bedroom. I'm a student, and I need my computer for schoolwork in the evening when my husband usually likes to watch Netflix in the bedroom. So I bought this, thinking I could plug it in to my bedroom TV so that I can use my computer for class. Nope. The wifi won't connect from in the bedroom, at least I assume that's the problem because it kept losing connection and refusing my passwords even though I KNOW they were correct. By the way, I live in a rather small apartment, the router is in our living room, maybe 20 feet away from the bedroom. So it's not like it was terribly far.Also, this may have been obvious to everyone else, but personally I didn't get that the stick has to be plugged into the wall at pretty much all times. From the description and pictures, I got the idea that you simply plug the stick in and start. This was also a let-down since the cord isn't particularly long, so if you have quite a distance between your HDMI port and wall outlet, that may be a problem.Anyway, I was super disappointed, since the whole reason I bought the thing was to use in in the bedroom, and I can't even do that. I ended up returning it.
author: Rachel C
